name: Swarm intelligence
tagline: Single Machine Scheduling using Swarm Intelligence Optimization Algorithms
body:
## Swarm_Intelligence ![swarm intelligence](https://octodex.github.com/images/yaktocat.png) *** The aim of this project is to replicate and extend the work done by D.T. Pham et al. in their paper "Using the Bees Algorithm to schedule jobs for a machine". This is a comparative study of various heuristics and metaheuristics applied to the Single Machine Scheduling problem. Various optimization algorithms will be compared and hybridized in order to minimize the earliness and tardiness penalties of a set of processes. The results will be compared to those in the original paper, as well as other solutions to the SMS problem.
This repository contains the Codeblocks Project(C++), and articles related to the work. Credit to M.E. O'Neill for providing an alternative to allow non-deterministic RNG for gcc on Windows, bypassing the random_device "bug".
http://www.pcg-random.org/blog/
https://www.reddit.com/r/cpp/comments/34yqxa/announcing_randutils_a_single_portable/
